question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. <katex>$r_1 = 20$</katex> cm, <katex>$I_1 = 4$</katex> kg m<katex>$^2$</katex>, <katex>$I_2 = 20$</katex> kg m<katex>$^2$</katex> and <katex>$r_2 = 30$</katex> cm. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/2025-phy-6-1.png

| Column I (Quantities) | Column II (Numerical Values in SI units) |
|---|---|
| (a) Angular acceleration of smaller wheel | (i) <katex>$\frac{5}{3}$</katex> |
| (b) Torque on the larger wheel | (ii) <katex>$\frac{100}{3}$</katex> |
| (c) Angular acceleration of larger wheel | (iii) <katex>$\frac{5}{2}$</katex> |
explanation: Since they are connected by a non-slipping belt, linear acceleration at the rim is same: <katex>$\alpha_2 r_2 = \alpha_1 r_1$</katex> [cite: 108]
Torque on larger wheel: <katex>$\tau_2 = I_2 \alpha_2 = 20 \times \frac{5}{3} = \frac{100}{3}$</katex> SI. (Matches ii) [cite: 115]
